title: You can always feel product/market fit when it's happening
author: Marc Andreessen
quote_text: And you can always feel product/market fit when it’s happening. The customers are buying the product just as fast as you can make it—or usage is growing just as fast as you can add more servers. Money from customers is piling up in your company checking account. You’re hiring sales and customer support staff as fast as you can. Reporters are calling because they’ve heard about your hot new thing and they want to talk to you about it. You start getting entrepreneur of the year awards from Harvard Business School. Investment bankers are staking out your house. You could eat free for a year at Buck’s

style_data.description: Franz Kline's bold gestural abstraction with confident black brushstrokes
style_data.base_prompt: Franz Kline style bold gestural abstraction with confident black brushstrokes creating dynamic movement, high contrast between black marks and white space, gestural energy captured in sweeping brush movements, minimal color palette emphasizing form and gesture over representation
style_data.expression_method: Raw gestural energy translated into confident brush movements
style_data.composition_flow: Dynamic movement created through bold stroke direction and rhythm
style_data.abstraction_level: Pure gesture and movement without representational content

prompt.text: Franz Kline style bold gestural abstraction with confident black brushstrokes creating dynamic movement, high contrast between black marks and white space, gestural energy captured in sweeping brush movements, minimal color palette emphasizing form and gesture over representation. Capturing the vibe of movement, flow, in-the-zone. square composition, centered focus, 1:1 aspect ratio

components.base: Franz Kline style bold gestural abstraction with confident black brushstrokes creating dynamic movement, high contrast between black marks and white space, gestural energy captured in sweeping brush movements, minimal color palette emphasizing form and gesture over representation
components.format: square composition, centered focus, 1:1 aspect ratio

metadata.why_i_like_it: Timeless pieece.  Describes the mission of investing annd building, and captures the feeling when it's working and when it's not, without listing a metric. I re-read it a couple times a year.

title: Start with the customer experience and work backwards to the technology
author: Steve Jobs
quote_text: You've gotta start with the customer experience and work backwards to the technology.

prompt.text: Capturing the vibe of clarity, revelation. square composition, centered focus, 1:1 aspect ratio

components.format: square composition, centered focus, 1:1 aspect ratio

metadata.why_i_like_it: Masterful clarity, inspiration and motivation. This encapsulates the entire philosophy of great product development - understanding what people actually need and want.

style_data.description: Claude Monet's broken brushwork technique capturing fleeting light effects
style_data.base_prompt: Claude Monet style impressionist technique with broken visible brushstrokes capturing fleeting effects of light and atmosphere, colors that interact and influence each other optically, emphasis on temporal specificity and momentary atmospheric conditions, loose brushwork suggesting form through color temperature and value
style_data.color_philosophy: Colors that interact optically to create new emotional temperatures and atmospheric effects
style_data.brush_approach: Quick confident strokes that capture essence and light rather than precise form
style_data.light_focus: Fleeting effects of light and atmosphere as primary subject matter

prompt.text: Claude Monet style impressionist technique with broken visible brushstrokes capturing fleeting effects of light and atmosphere, colors that interact and influence each other optically, emphasis on temporal specificity and momentary atmospheric conditions, loose brushwork suggesting form through color temperature and value. components.base: Claude Monet style impressionist technique with broken visible brushstrokes capturing fleeting effects of light and atmosphere, colors that interact and influence each other optically, emphasis on temporal specificity and momentary atmospheric conditions, loose brushwork suggesting form through color temperature and value

metadata.why_i_like_it: PG's wisdom resonates with me. This is the best single encapsulation of a startup or product mission I have come across. I try to challenge myself with this often.
